Description: Terracotta figure fragment, possibly from a mould-made protome of a woman. Fragment of hair or cloth drapery. Red-brown Nile silt fabric (7.5R 5/6) with fine gold mica, organics, quartz, white, red and grey inclusions (1mm).
Curator's comments: A small number of East Greek style protomes of Classical Greek date appear to have been made locally at Naukratis and placed in the Hellenion (Oxford, Ashmolean Museum AN1896-1908-E.4657, AN1896-1908-G.79; Cambridge, Museum of Classical Archaeology NA823, NA820, NA766, NA464, NA317), though the majority were imported from East Greece and of types typically found on Rhodes. If indeed from a protome, then likely significantly earlier in date than the context in which it was found.
Bibliographic references: Leonard 2001 / Ancient Naukratis: Excavations at a Greek Emporion in Egypt, Part II: The excavations at Kom Hadid. (p. 171, no.14 pl. 3.12.)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (DC.017) (Phase 3)
Additional IDs: Miscellaneous number: pl. 3.12, p. 171. no.14 (catalogue number)
